commits.author: dipnlik
commits.summary: Edit contents of tag created via <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃W</kbd>
commits.body:
It's now possible to: press <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃W</kbd>, type the tag name and attributes, <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇥</kbd>, type it's contents, then <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇥</kbd> again to exit the tag.  Previously, it wasn't easy to reach the tag contents.

The existing functionality of having selected text then pressing <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃W</kbd> to enclose it between tags remains.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Change script to support Safari from 10.11.5 update
commits.body: Safari now requires toggling an option to allow javascript to be run through Apple events, we now get the url of the current tab and set it as the url to reload avoiding needing to toggle this option. Fixes #41.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Switch to pure AppleScript for Refresh Running Browser(s)
commits.body:
This simplifies the script as Safari has ballooned into many separate processes some which are left open without Safari. Removes support for Internet Explorer because… yeah… also removes support for OmniWeb as will not currently run under El Capitan. Adds support for WebKit nightly releases.

Note: Due to AppleScript features used this now requires 10.5+

commits.author: Kai Wood
commits.summary: Change regex to match HTML tags better
commits.body:
Since 04a714a465f7deba2c0618a0024adc843c93e805 one can use Select Enclosing Typing Pairs for HTML tags. This fails short if custom HTML tags are in between, like Angular directives (which contain dashes, "-") or some of the tags Facebook uses for its integration stuff (which contain double colons, ":").

With this change, one can select the typing pairs properly.
